title: RIS files with A1 (and A2, A3, A4?) tags are corrupted on the export

milestone.title: v1.0
milestone.description: Milestone for the release of version 1.0.

body:
Current implementation of RIS exporter in ASReview doesn't handle author tags in RIS incorrectly (if not `AU`). RIS supports 5 tags for authors: `AU`, `A1`, `A2`, `A3`, `A4`. Currently we only support AU, see: 

https://github.com/asreview/asreview/blob/2572dd425c093e7c193effbf1dcfcd113c33e72f/asreview/io/ris_writer.py#L51

## Relevant code

I'm not sure what the actual issue is at the moment. Some relevant code snippets are:

```python
>>> from rispy import TAG_KEY_MAPPING
>>> from pprint import pprint
>>> pprint(TAG_KEY_MAPPING)
{'A1': 'first_authors',
 'A2': 'secondary_authors',
 'A3': 'tertiary_authors',
 'A4': 'subsidiary_authors',
 'AB': 'abstract',
 'AD': 'author_address',
 'AN': 'accession_number',
 'AU': 'authors',
```

ASReview only recognizes `AU` and `A1`:
https://github.com/asreview/asreview/blob/2572dd425c093e7c193effbf1dcfcd113c33e72f/asreview/config.py#L49


## Example of export from Mendeley 

```
TY  - JOUR
T1  - The effect of offenders' sex on reporting crimes to the police
A1  - Wong, Thessa M.L.
A1  - van de Schoot, Rens
Y1  - 2012/05//
KW  - Crime reporting
KW  - Robbery with assault
KW  - Sex differences
KW  - Victim-offender relationship
KW  - Victims
JF  - Journal of Interpersonal Violence
VL  - 27
IS  - 7
SP  - 1276
EP  - 1292
DO  - 10.1177/0886260511425245
N2  - This article examines the difference in victims' reporting behavior regarding crimes committed by males and by females. The authors expect that victims of female offenders are less likely to report to the police than victims of male offenders because of differences in the victim-offender relationship as well as in the victim's sex. With recent developments in Bayesian statistics, new tools have become available that enable the direct evaluation of researchers' expectations. All cases of robbery with assault from the National Crime Victimization Survey have been investigated (n = 478). Findings reveal that female offenders are underreported compared with male offenders and that this can be explained by the victim characteristics but only in combination with the offender's sex. © The Author(s) 2012.
ER  - 
TY  - JOUR
T1  - Meaning-in-life orientations and values in youth: Cross-cultural comparison
A1  - Gorlova, Natalia
A1  - Romanyuk, Lyudmyla
A1  - Vanbrabant, Leonard
A1  - van de Schoot, Rens
Y1  - 2012/11//
KW  - Meaning of life
KW  - Measurement invariance
KW  - Purpose in life
KW  - The Meaning-in-Life Orientations test
JF  - European Journal of Developmental Psychology
VL  - 9
IS  - 6
SP  - 744
EP  - 750
DO  - 10.1080/17405629.2012.689823
N2  - Search for purposes in life and the meaning of life is one of the developmental tasks in youth. The Meaning-in-Life Orientations test (MOL) is often used to assess purposes in life and meaningfulness of life and is often used to compare individuals and groups. It is yet unclear whether this test shows measurement invariance across different countries or not, which was the main object of the current study. First, confirmatory factor analyses were conducted separately for data sets with Russian and Ukrainian students. Second, metric and scalar invariance were tested. Finally, comparisons between Russian and Ukrainian students were made on their scores on the MOL. © 2012 Copyright Taylor and Francis Group, LLC.
ER  - 
```


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12981139/157640876-7bd28d35-3b14-4eaa-9bd1-334ac8c54f3f.png)


## Quickfix / temp fix

1. Open the RIS file in a text editor
2. Replace `A1  - ` by `AU  - `
3. Open file in ASReview
